reviews.text: Not bad for what it costs and what you get. Probably would come back- we were in a hurry and it was late and this was one of the few places that seemed good. It was! Definitely not the absolute best pizza but also not the worst. The people who work here are so nice too. They have some fun art work up as well.

The Pizza is the best I‚Äôve ever had because: made to order, fresh house made sauce, extensive options, easy to order a custom, they have ‚Äòbigger than your face‚Äô single slices if you don‚Äôt want/need an 8 inch or bigger, great customer service from the lady who helped me, and they have great priced cannolis made fresh. I even talked to the owners son about catering and was happy to hear he said they will limit the order because they refuse to lower the quality of the pizza just for profit. Great business!

Good pizza - close to BYU so good for students. I would have liked it around when I was a student. I got it by the slice. Best pizza in provo? Probably not but it was crispy and wasn‚Äôt too expensive. I was happy I went. It felt like a good hangout place.

Nico's is a nice addition to the inventory of pizza places in Provo. The Queen Margotte thin crust pizza was properly done; it's not too soft or burnt. It took less than fifteen minutes to get the pizzas. Herbs and balsamic vinegar are available. Free parking lot, plenty of tables, order at the counter. A 12" and 8" pizza cost about $32.

Nico‚Äôs pizza is so good! No complaints at all! The flavors, ingredients, the dough and how it was cooked, all perfect. I recently went to New York and tried multiple famous pizza places, and Nico‚Äôs was honestly better. Loved it! Our kids loved it too, saying it‚Äôs their favorite pizza place. Also, the breadsticks looked kind of meh, but ended up tasting amazing!

editorial_summary.overview: Informal counter-service shop specializing in Boston-style pizza, plus other casual Italian food.

recentReviews.text:
Nunca habr√≠a pensado que esta pizzer√≠a fuera tan adictiva para mi, todos los d√≠as compro mi ensalada con mis slices, y quedo tan satisfecho y a un precio tan bajo
A veces no me alcanza el dinero y siempre tengo points acumulados que me salvan el d√≠a, son unos genios en su totalidad.
No se c√≥mo hacen para contratar a los trabajadores pero absolutamente todos son excelentes atendiendo, siempre sonrientes, me tienen mucha paciencia a pesar de que mi ingl√©s no es muy bueno y me tratan como si fuese un amigo m√°s o un familiar m√°s, son incre√≠bles, deber√≠an darles una aumento a TODOS sus trabajadores.
SISTER MISSIONARIES WAS HERE. SOOOO GOOD. WORKERS GOOD. FOOD BOMB. 10/10 MUST RECOMMEND
I thought the pizza was excellent and the staff was friendly. Will purchase their pizza again for sure.
I had the slice combo with salad and drink. Great value. It's the kind of pizza that makes my East Coast tummy rejoice over.

The Pizza is the best I‚Äôve ever had because: made to order, fresh house made sauce, extensive options, easy to order a custom, they have ‚Äòbigger than your face‚Äô single slices if you don‚Äôt want/need an 8 inch or bigger, great customer service from the lady who helped me, and they have great priced cannolis made fresh. I even talked to the owners son about catering and was happy to hear he said they will limit the order because they refuse to lower the quality of the pizza just for profit. Great business!
Honestly this was expensive for very mid pizza. And the salads were a joke. Save money and buy the same food at a high school cafeteria. The workers were nice though.

detailedReviews.text:

A veces no me alcanza el dinero y siempre tengo points acumulados que me salvan el d√≠a, son unos genios en su totalidad.

detailedReviews.author: Lavei Aiono
detailedReviews.text: SISTER MISSIONARIES WAS HERE. SOOOO GOOD. WORKERS GOOD. FOOD BOMB. 10/10 MUST RECOMMEND

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Wilson
detailedReviews.text: I thought the pizza was excellent and the staff was friendly. Will purchase their pizza again for sure.

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Bowen
detailedReviews.text: I had the slice combo with salad and drink. Great value. It's the kind of pizza that makes my East Coast tummy rejoice over.

detailedReviews.author: Nico
detailedReviews.text: The Pizza is the best I‚Äôve ever had because: made to order, fresh house made sauce, extensive options, easy to order a custom, they have ‚Äòbigger than your face‚Äô single slices if you don‚Äôt want/need an 8 inch or bigger, great customer service from the lady who helped me, and they have great priced cannolis made fresh. I even talked to the owners son about catering and was happy to hear he said they will limit the order because they refuse to lower the quality of the pizza just for profit. Great business!

detailedReviews.author: Lauren Stanley
detailedReviews.text: Honestly this was expensive for very mid pizza. And the salads were a joke. Save money and buy the same food at a high school cafeteria. The workers were nice though.

detailedReviews.author: Dan's Inferno
detailedReviews.text: Nico's is a nice addition to the inventory of pizza places in Provo. The Queen Margotte thin crust pizza was properly done; it's not too soft or burnt. It took less than fifteen minutes to get the pizzas. Herbs and balsamic vinegar are available. Free parking lot, plenty of tables, order at the counter. A 12" and 8" pizza cost about $32.

detailedReviews.author: KB Smiles
detailedReviews.text:
I miss this place. One of the few things I miss about Utah. I'm back in Massachusetts and I can't even get pizza as good anymore. I decided to see if this place was still open for business and was so happy to see it's continued to do so well. Y'all, are lucky enjoy the good Boston style pizza. I can't even get anything as good here anymore. Everything has gone down hill here. Mostly, very commercial style now. Nothing like the good ol days of Boston style pizza. Y'all, don't even know how lucky you are with Nicko's.

He used to get his cannolis from Little Italy and Boston I'm not sure if that's still the case. That place has become so commercialized now. I did find a place that's much better than the place he gets his from. If you're ever in Boston check out Bova bakery it's on the same street as the old North Church. Little hole in the wall place. It's incredible for pastries!

Enjoy your good Pizza and bread sticks! They're literally the best. Miss that place.

Used to feel like home away from home. Me and my other friend Deg from Boston would go there pretty often.

detailedReviews.author: Alicia
detailedReviews.text: Not bad for what it costs and what you get. Probably would come back- we were in a hurry and it was late and this was one of the few places that seemed good. It was! Definitely not the absolute best pizza but also not the worst. The people who work here are so nice too. They have some fun art work up as well.

detailedReviews.author: Doug Bush
detailedReviews.text: Good pizza - close to BYU so good for students. I would have liked it around when I was a student. I got it by the slice. Best pizza in provo? Probably not but it was crispy and wasn‚Äôt too expensive. I was happy I went. It felt like a good hangout place.

detailedReviews.author: Sophie W
detailedReviews.text: Ok yall, this is a Mark Anthony fan accountüôå I get it every time I come here, and every time it‚Äôs better than I remember! Worth every penny.

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Stewart
detailedReviews.text: I love the atmosphere! Feels very welcoming and the pizza is alas great! There are so many unique pies like the green monster, tonalli, eye of the tiger!

detailedReviews.author: Megan Sorensen
detailedReviews.text: Nico‚Äôs is the best pizza around! The variety of pies is astounding and all are delicious! Not to mention all the other scrumptious food they offer. Scarpas are my favorite and only made better by their amazing house made creamy vinaigrette dressing! The staff is friendly and accommodating!

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Newcomb
detailedReviews.text: Great flavor. I love the crisp they have to their crust. Their signature range is amazing.

detailedReviews.author: Lindsey
detailedReviews.text: Service is always fantastic, and the pizza is amazing and hot from the oven. Atmosphere is fun and casual, and I'm always so happy with my experience. Thanks Nicos!

detailedReviews.author: Sarah Goertzen
detailedReviews.text: Eat here as much as you can. We live in St. George and had been craving Nico‚Äôs for a while. When we finally got the chance to go in tonight, it was sooooo gooooood. And what made things even better, David, knowing how we‚Äôve craved Nico‚Äôs pizza and sauce, offered a kind gesture that enhanced our experience even more. We have been coming here since they opened and we will keep coming back until we‚Äôre 101.

detailedReviews.author: Sher I
detailedReviews.text: Cute little pizza place in a college town. They serve slices (and whole pies but call ahead as the wait time can be long) that are filling due to size and they have variety. Side salad was delish as well. Book exchange in the corner and a few tv‚Äôs for sporting events.

detailedReviews.author: Jerri Henderson
detailedReviews.text: The best pizza I have ever had. Very friendly service.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Quinonez
detailedReviews.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a late-night spot to grab a bite and stumbled upon Nico's Pizza‚Äîand we're so glad we did! From the moment we walked in, the girl cashier greeted us with a warm, friendly welcome that instantly made us feel at home. The pizza was absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Their house sauce deserves a special shoutout too‚Äîit was spot on and really brought everything together. We‚Äôll definitely be back, and we highly recommend it to anyone in the area!

detailedReviews.author: Oziel Ruiz (Randomguy16)
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was delicious. The order was quick ‚Äî in and out in a few minutes. When I arrived, it mostly seemed like people just ordered and picked up, but there were enough tables to seat a good number of people.

detailedReviews.author: Sakina D
detailedReviews.text: Delicious calzones that are fully customizable. The pesto pizza was killer. I will be returning to try their other pizzas :)

detailedReviews.author: Lauren Tolley
detailedReviews.text:
The food and service is fantastic! Best pizza in Provo!
Excellent place for a date!!!

detailedReviews.author: Cindy White
detailedReviews.text: Cool concept of late night by the slice great price will be coming here again

detailedReviews.author: Josh B
detailedReviews.text: great atmosphere but the pizza is 6 times out of 10 doughy and almost play-dough like..

detailedReviews.author: Matthais
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is great, but ordering in person takes a long time to get your food. Unfortunately their online ordering is permanently down, and if you're lucky enough to have someone there answer a phone call, they're quite rude and seem unwilling to help when you give them the wrong name for a menu item (I was trying to order their bread stick bites and I said garlic bites, sue me). Told me they didn't have anything like that. Unlucky.

detailedReviews.author: Nathan Burdette
detailedReviews.text: Nico‚Äôs is good, like the breadsticks, slice of the day is not bad, kinda thinner but still good. Also their Nico‚Äôs sauce is very good and when you go and ask them for one, they say how many? That is what every place should say when you ask for an additional sauce.

detailedReviews.author: Matt Whitaker
detailedReviews.text: Best meaty pizza in Utah County!

detailedReviews.author: Nicia Whitaker
detailedReviews.text: Their crusts are the best! And coupled with the sweet and tangy BBQ sauce on their BBQ Chicken pizza -- can't be beat!!

detailedReviews.author: Brett Birkeland
detailedReviews.text: I hesitate to tell people how good this pizza place is, lest it become more busy. The breadsticks are lowkey life-changing. Their house sauce is unique and fantastic. We love the Hawaiian most and always wish we would have ordered more breadsticks.

detailedReviews.author: Brady Crump
detailedReviews.text: Nico‚Äôs pizza is so good! No complaints at all! The flavors, ingredients, the dough and how it was cooked, all perfect. I recently went to New York and tried multiple famous pizza places, and Nico‚Äôs was honestly better. Loved it! Our kids loved it too, saying it‚Äôs their favorite pizza place. Also, the breadsticks looked kind of meh, but ended up tasting amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Rich E
detailedReviews.text: If you like Boston Style Pizza and you are in Utah, you have to go to Nico‚Äôs.  I walked in skeptical and left very very happy!  ordered a large cheese, well done crispy and they knew exactly what that meant !  It was so good, I thought about ordering another pie to go. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit.  Nicely done Nicos‚Ä¶..keep up the great work!

detailedReviews.author: mitch Nel
detailedReviews.text: Love this place! Been going for several years now and its my favorite stop in the county for New York style pizza. Thin crust excellence! Never disappointed!

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Bowman
detailedReviews.text: Undercooked and doughy. Not good. Go to Little Caesar‚Äôs instead.

detailedReviews.author: Leo Jamias
detailedReviews.text: Nice hot pizza's, delicious, and good service.

detailedReviews.author: Skyler Swaney
detailedReviews.text: I came here on a whim one day because it was right next to the UPS store. I have been converted into a regular customer. The staff are exceptional and the food is delicious and very reasonably priced. I‚Äôve been looking for a good by the slice pizza place. I have yet to be disappointed by a flavor!

detailedReviews.author: sarah nh
detailedReviews.text: Wicked good pizza and wicked friendly staff!

detailedReviews.author: Kallista Claessens
detailedReviews.text: The lady taking orders was super happy and friendly and the good tastes great

detailedReviews.author: Josh Andrus
detailedReviews.text: The only thing they need to do to make it more authentic is to bully you at the counter so you'll pay in cash so they can evade taxes. It's a crispy slice! 7.8

detailedReviews.author: Phillip Broadbent
detailedReviews.text: Probably the best pizza place in utah

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Bennett
detailedReviews.text: Good customer service Also nice people clean inside an I enjoyed my Half Pepperoni  hawaiian And  variety of pizzas and other stuff an they have drinks    they were both cooked fully

detailedReviews.author: Patti Tripp
detailedReviews.text: We got a Margarita pizza and were shocked that they no longer have freshly, minced garlic. It was completely covered with garlic powder! So sad!

detailedReviews.author: Anne S.
detailedReviews.text: This is a great little pizza place. They sell pizza by the slice in combos that come with bread sticks and a drink for less than $10. My kids love the breadsticks and the pizzas good too! If you're not a fan of bread they have a slice of pizza,drink and a salad option. My favorite is their Greek salad with the house dressing. They don't skimp on salad or pizza toppings. We definitely recommend going here!

detailedReviews.author: Rich Paustenbaugh
detailedReviews.text: Average pizza, at $6.50 per slice below average.

detailedReviews.author: Spencer Yazzie
detailedReviews.text: The food was great!!!!! The breadsticks with the house sauce was FLAWLESS 10/10. Pizza was great. If you haven't come yet, you better find a way here...th3 bus? Uber? Worth it!!!

detailedReviews.author: Isaac Buckley
detailedReviews.text: My favorite place to get pizza in Provo! Always great to get good food at a great price. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Will definitely be coming back soon

detailedReviews.author: Jordan Isbell
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in the state of Utah. I said what I said and you can‚Äôt convince me otherwise. Been coming for years and quality has been consistent the whole time. Spicy Hawaiian and Italian Stallion are GOAT. Don‚Äôt forget the house dressing and breadsticks. üíØ

detailedReviews.author: Mary Williams
detailedReviews.text: I love the margarita pizza and the Nico‚Äôs special! Their salads are good too and super full.

detailedReviews.author: Aubree Bingham
detailedReviews.text: a gateway for giggles. incredible service. that isaac rallison gentleman served with a light that could brighten the darkest night.

detailedReviews.author: Victoria Rivera
detailedReviews.text: First time visiting Provo and had a very pleasant experience. The food and service were awesome and the staff was very friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Indefatigable
detailedReviews.text: Seriously good pizza. Nico is a g

detailedReviews.author: John Schlitters
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, great prices, great portions. I come here once a week and it's easy to see why they've earned their awards and recognition!

detailedReviews.author: Joey Brazzeal
detailedReviews.text: Very good bread sticks! Got the chicken parm a little disappointed but everything else was great !

detailedReviews.author: Parker Adair
detailedReviews.text:
This is a legendary pizza joint in my mind. I've eaten here close to 50 times. Nearly every menu item is incredible. My favorite thing is the pizza by the slice that changes daily. It always comes out hot and tastes fresh, not like heat lamp pizza.

The staff is friendly and if they make mistakes they will compensate you for it.

detailedReviews.author: Kenna Christopherson
detailedReviews.text: I've only been to Nico's twice, but I have to say this place is amazing! Their customer service is on another level and don't even get me started on their food. The Pizza and Bread Sticks are the best I've ever had. I would 100% recommend coming here!

detailedReviews.author: dylan DeMille
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and their employee Emma was very helpful. Best spot in town!

detailedReviews.author: Mike Talbot
detailedReviews.text: Fabulous NY pizza in the heart of Provo! Who would know? So delicious!!

detailedReviews.author: JoLayne Cline
detailedReviews.text: Bought a $30 pizza that was really soggy. When I lifted it up it was limp. Really disappointed because I liked their pizza in the past. After that I won‚Äôt be coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Karissa Phelps
detailedReviews.text: Super delicious, Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Had the mark Anthony and cucina paraiso. Lots of flavor

detailedReviews.author: henry li
detailedReviews.text: This place is so ridiculously expensive and the service is slow. They hired a bunch of young people who just yap in the back. I would not recommend this place when there are cheaper and just as good or better places around.

detailedReviews.author: Lauralee B. Gonzalez
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in Utah. Get your slice extra crispy. SO GOOD.

detailedReviews.author: Gaby Barsh
detailedReviews.text: My fave pizza shop in the valley

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Starkweather
detailedReviews.text: I love the vibe of Nicos. The service is fantastic and the pizza is supreme. Friendly staff makes me love coming here.

detailedReviews.author: Ethan Plothow
detailedReviews.text: This place is so amazing, breadsticks were crazy good. Price is reasonable and service was quick and so good. Would give 7 stars if possible

detailedReviews.author: Christie
detailedReviews.text: I am from New York and moved to Utah 2 years ago. This is the only pizza place I've found in Utah so far that even comes close to comparing to pizza there. The calzones are good too!  The only downside is that sometimes wait times are long because they're so busy. üôÇ

detailedReviews.author: Meghan Humphries
detailedReviews.text: Such an amazing family/work/date spot. It's perfect for everything because it's inexpensive, a great value, and delicious! My whole family loves Nico's.

detailedReviews.author: Dave Wilson
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôve been eating at Nico‚Äôs since Nico from Boston opened the place well over 15 years ago. The pizza is usually really good.

Last night we ordered the mozzarella sticks for the first time. They are not good. For the first time I had something at Nico‚Äôs that was really disgusting. They taste nothing like traditional mozzarella sticks you‚Äôll get anywhere else.

I hope Nico‚Äôs changes these out. They aren‚Äôt good. None of my kids liked them either. We ordered 12, each took a bite and left the rest.

detailedReviews.author: Justin Gertsch
detailedReviews.text: The apps(mozzarella sticks and meat balls) were pretty good but the pizza is really not that great. The three pizzas we ordered were margherita, spicy Hawaiian, and eye of the tiger. Pretty bland across the board. There are way better pizza places in Utah so don't waste your time here.

detailedReviews.author: Abram Hadfield
detailedReviews.text: Family owned and operated this place is my favorite pizza place. The really take care of their pizza, their customers, and their staff. And it shows. My friends and I love Nico‚Äôs and we will be coming again and again.

detailedReviews.author: Jon Doe
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza and even better house sauce! I love their breaded ravioli as well!!

detailedReviews.author: Monte Webster
detailedReviews.text: A  thin crust style pizza with plenty of topping choices.  The crust and bread sticks are good, if not a bit unremarkable.  The staff was effective and cheerful.

detailedReviews.author: Jamie Drake
detailedReviews.text: Super good pie ü§§ü§§

detailedReviews.author: Cameron Bradshaw
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza and bread sticks ever!!

detailedReviews.author: Adam Hill
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, felt like I was back in NY. Service was a little slow, but they were also packed

detailedReviews.author: Todd Wood
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza and wonderful service! One of the best pizza places in Utah.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the excellent customer service, with staff being friendly, patient, and treating customers like family. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The pizza is praised for its fresh, made-to-order quality with house-made sauce and extensive customization options, including large single slices. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The restaurant offers great value with slice combos that include salad and drink, appealing to customers looking for affordable meal options. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and slow service - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews about food quality and service - review management can address this concern
Lack of awareness about the restaurant's atmosphere and unique offerings - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.text:

A veces no me alcanza el dinero y siempre tengo points acumulados que me salvan el d√≠a, son unos genios en su totalidad.
No se c√≥mo hacen para contratar a los trabajadores pero absolutamente todos son excelentes atendiendo, siempre sonrientes, me tienen mucha paciencia a pesar de que mi ingl√©s no es muy bueno y me tratan como si fuese un amigo m√°s o un familiar m√°s, son incre√≠bles, deber√≠an darles una aumento a TODOS sus trabajadores.

positive.author: Lavei Aiono
positive.text: SISTER MISSIONARIES WAS HERE. SOOOO GOOD. WORKERS GOOD. FOOD BOMB. 10/10 MUST RECOMMEND

neutral.author: Josh B
neutral.text: great atmosphere but the pizza is 6 times out of 10 doughy and almost play-dough like..

negative.author: Lauren Stanley
negative.text: Honestly this was expensive for very mid pizza. And the salads were a joke. Save money and buy the same food at a high school cafeteria. The workers were nice though.

negative.author: Matthais
negative.text: Pizza is great, but ordering in person takes a long time to get your food. Unfortunately their online ordering is permanently down, and if you're lucky enough to have someone there answer a phone call, they're quite rude and seem unwilling to help when you give them the wrong name for a menu item (I was trying to order their bread stick bites and I said garlic bites, sue me). Told me they didn't have anything like that. Unlucky.

negative.author: Daniel Bowman
negative.text: Undercooked and doughy. Not good. Go to Little Caesar‚Äôs instead.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
